body:
>affirmations

>manifesting

>astrology

>crystals

>chakras

Why are so many modern women under 30 into literal magical thinking? What is this? Is this just religion for people who think they're edgey or cool? Is it just that women crave spirituality and religion but the modern foid must also be fiercely against traditionalism so they can't just be Christian? I do not understand.

Or is this just more female outsourcing responsibility to an extreme? It's extreme disownership. Anything that goes wrong they cannot be blamed for because the universe did it and it had nothing to do with their own actions and self, and anything that goes right is being gifted to them because they're just that special and deserve it.
body_html:
affirmations

manifesting

astrology

crystals

chakras

Why are so many modern women under 30 into literal magical thinking? What is this? Is this just religion for people who think they're edgey or cool? Is it just that women crave spirituality and religion but the modern foid must also be fiercely against traditionalism so they can't just be Christian? I do not understand.

Or is this just more female outsourcing responsibility to an extreme? It's extreme disownership. Anything that goes wrong they cannot be blamed for because the universe did it and it had nothing to do with their own actions and self, and anything that goes right is being gifted to them because they're just that special and deserve it.
title: Why are so many modern women engaging in magical thinking?

post.title: Why are so many modern women engaging in magical thinking?

body:
Every person desires to pursue the numinous. I think modern young women fill this void with vapid, shallow spiritualism like those listed because it is supposed to be a subjective experience and therefore no one can say they're doing it (or anything else) wrong. 

In short, many young women haven't matured enough to want to follow rules and see that doing so will benefit them. I think some women consequentially mature on this point when they have children. Even if they do not follow an objective set of morals for themselves they almost always insist their children do.
body_html:
Every person desires to pursue the numinous. I think modern young women fill this void with vapid, shallow spiritualism like those listed because it is supposed to be a subjective experience and therefore no one can say they're doing it (or anything else) wrong.

In short, many young women haven't matured enough to want to follow rules and see that doing so will benefit them. I think some women consequentially mature on this point when they have children. Even if they do not follow an objective set of morals for themselves they almost always insist their children do.

post.title: Why are so many modern women engaging in magical thinking?

body:
I don't think "magical" thinking is new, or different, or modern. I'm pagan and I have disdain for affirmations, astrology, crystals and chakras. That's not what my religion is about, IMPO. It's not about casting spells, either. But those things are tens of thousands of years old. People have always fallen for "magic". They've always believed in things that aren't real, or fallen for cults throughout countless ages. 

This is just the newest thing, not the first thing, or even the 10 mil'th thing people have fallen for. 

>Or is this just more female outsourcing responsibility to an extreme? 

I know the religion you're thinking of. It's extreme disownership. Anything that goes wrong they cannot be blamed for because it was God's Will, God did it, and God always has a "plan" and it had nothing to do with their own actions and self, and anything that goes right is being gifted to them because they're just that special and deserve it because if you just pray hard enough God will pay attention to your 1st world problems while completely ignoring a child dying in a ditch in a third world country. Its called Christianity.
body_html:
I don't think "magical" thinking is new, or different, or modern. I'm pagan and I have disdain for affirmations, astrology, crystals and chakras. That's not what my religion is about, IMPO. It's not about casting spells, either. But those things are tens of thousands of years old. People have always fallen for "magic". They've always believed in things that aren't real, or fallen for cults throughout countless ages.

This is just the newest thing, not the first thing, or even the 10 mil'th thing people have fallen for.

Or is this just more female outsourcing responsibility to an extreme?

I know the religion you're thinking of. It's extreme disownership. Anything that goes wrong they cannot be blamed for because it was God's Will, God did it, and God always has a "plan" and it had nothing to do with their own actions and self, and anything that goes right is being gifted to them because they're just that special and deserve it because if you just pray hard enough God will pay attention to your 1st world problems while completely ignoring a child dying in a ditch in a third world country. Its called Christianity.

post.body:
>affirmations

>manifesting

>astrology

>crystals

>chakras

Why are so many modern women under 30 into literal magical thinking? What is this? Is this just religion for people who think they're edgey or cool? Is it just that women crave spirituality and religion but the modern foid must also be fiercely against traditionalism so they can't just be Christian? I do not understand.

Or is this just more female outsourcing responsibility to an extreme? It's extreme disownership. Anything that goes wrong they cannot be blamed for because the universe did it and it had nothing to do with their own actions and self, and anything that goes right is being gifted to them because they're just that special and deserve it.
post.body_html:
affirmations

manifesting

astrology

crystals

chakras

Is it just that women crave spirituality and religion but the modern foid must also be fiercely against traditionalism so they can't just be Christian? I do not understand.

Or is this just more female outsourcing responsibility to an extreme? It's extreme disownership. Anything that goes wrong they cannot be blamed for because the universe did it and it had nothing to do with their own actions and self, and anything that goes right is being gifted to them because they're just that special and deserve it.
post.title: Why are so many modern women engaging in magical thinking?

body:

Manifesting is a waste of time you could be acting.

body:
Never. Pagans burned the Green Man in effigy as a symbol of summer's end, not actual people. When was the last time the Christians burned someone alive? Oh yeah, 1782. 

When you stop basing a major religion around the zodiac and astrological signs of the sun based on fortune telling/divination by a man claiming to be God, and then drink his blood in a symbolic magical ritual to take his disembodied spirit into you to be possessed by it.... then you can bitch about pagans being weird and using magic.
body_html:
Never. Pagans burned the Green Man in effigy as a symbol of summer's end, not actual people. When was the last time the Christians burned someone alive? Oh yeah, 1782.

When you stop basing a major religion around the zodiac and astrological signs of the sun based on fortune telling/divination by a man claiming to be God, and then drink his blood in a symbolic magical ritual to take his disembodied spirit into you to be possessed by it.... then you can bitch about pagans being weird and using magic.

body: Women have a tendency to be drawn to the unseen. Think of the term "feminine intuition". Men are more likely to rely entirely on the tangible world around them. That's where a man's strength lays; in the physical.
